Reviews.Title: Motorola WX345 Volume Too Low and Vibration Too Weak
Reviews.Author: R. Barnett
Reviews.Content: If you have noise around you, such as in a casino, you cannot hear the incoming call sound if the phone is in your pocket. To hear the call in a noisy area, you must have it in your hand and up near your ears. The volume control is located on the side of the phone where you would typically grasp the phone and that action will often inadvertently turn the volume control even lower. The vibration is so weak that you must have the phone in your hand... you will not feel the vibration if the phone is in your pocket. Not happy with this phone.

Reviews.Title: No Faults Found
Reviews.Author: C. Stacy
Reviews.Content: While shopping for a case, I found these reviews. I want to counter the negative reports.  My wife and I each have had these phones for over a year, with no problems or complaints whatsoever.  They came free with our Consumer Cellular accounts.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: A. Ralph Senn
Reviews.Content: Quick, brand new (even though sold as new), and works perfectly.I would order it again when needed.  Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Vincent
Reviews.Content: easy to set up and use. had no problems with either especially with consumer cell. will buy the product again

Reviews.Title: Battery Life SUCKS...
Reviews.Author: L. Jones "Gentle_Raven"
Reviews.Content: It's a nice phone over all. The features are great, except for the battery which has to be charged every other day at best. I have the Blue Tooth disabled thinking that would help, but the battery still dies rapidly. Called customer service for a different battery (the sent one to me for free), but it is no better.

Reviews.Title: Good Simple Phone
Reviews.Author: Hal
Reviews.Content: I purchased this used phone as a replacement while my other phone (same model) was in for warranty repair.  Motorola needs 7-10 days to repair or replace the original phone and I couldn't go without a phone for that long.  It will now become my backup.  The phone itself is a very functional phone without many bells and whistles, but I use it as a phone and nothing else.  It fits my needs perfectly.  I will add the used phone came looking and working like brand new.

Reviews.Title: Works for Me
Reviews.Author: J. Price "jprice66"
Reviews.Content: I have had two of these phones for almost 2 years and they have never let me down.  Very reliable performance.  Battery life is good.  It is a spartan phone, you use it to make and receive phone calls.  Text messaging is a chore but it can be done.  The camera is OK in bright sunlight, and forwarding a picture is easy.  The pictures appear much better quality when downloaded and viewed on a PC.  For me, the major con was no phone-book software for the PC.  With my previous el-cheapo LG I could edit and maintain my phone number list on the PC.

Reviews.Title: Cell phone
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: This was a gift and he is enjoying this one.  I bought two and the other one was used and it cost more to mail back than what the phone was worth.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone, bad customer service
Reviews.Author: Civicowner
Reviews.Content: After receiving this phone, I realized I couldn't use it with my SIM card. I tried to return it, but got no response either time I emailed the seller. It was a nice little phone, but I really have no use for it.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable for basic use
Reviews.Author: Retired Washingtonian
Reviews.Content: This phone has a basic design flaw.  The volume controls are on the side of the phone, meaning if you keep the phone in your pocket (as I do), you are liable to inadvertently lower the ring volume every time you grasp it.  This has caused me to miss a number of calls.  Even when the volume is on high, however, it is too low to be heard outdoors when stored in your pocket.  Although this phone has a number of features, I use a phone only for making and receiving calls, and since I can't do that reliably, it flunks my test.

Reviews.Title: Phone is prone to display loss
Reviews.Author: JAD "Joe"
Reviews.Content: This phone has many nice features however if you can't see the menu or home screen to use it what good are they? Many complaints of the home screen going blank (all white) after coming out of power save mode. You cannot fix it. If you turn it off for 5 minutes or more or pull the battery and mem chips then puttting them back in, it may come back on. Motorola has a problem with warrantying this problem also. Claim abuse or whateever they can to not replace or fix it.. buyer beware

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Edward Behn
Reviews.Content: I'd had this phone for ~2 months when the display broke.  I had to mail it back to the manufacturer to get the display replaced.  When I got it back, the display broke AGAIN.  I got it for free and it was a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: Works ONLY with Consumer Cellular Network
Reviews.Author: W. A. Morey
Reviews.Content: Nothing in the product description indicated that this phone was exclusively programmed to work ONLY with Consumer Cellular network.  I am sending it back, and will see if there is any delay in getting my account credited.  This review requires a rating in order to post, so for the time being, I'm giving it a one star. If my credit is posted quickly, then I'll change it to 5 stars, since the shipping on this item was very quick.  I'll keep you posted.

ProductInfo.Name: Consumer Cellular Motorola WX345 Cell Phone
